clinical_study.brief_title: Leptin and Visfatin in Diabetic Patients With Periodontitis Before and After Periodontal Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Non-surgical Periodontal Therapy on Leptin and Visfatin Expression in Gingival Tissues of Chronic Periodontitis With and Without Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: A Study Utilizing ELISA and Real Time PCR

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Are adipokines involved in pathogenesis of periodontal disease in diabetic patients?
2. Does their level change after periodontal therapy?

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with chronic periodontitis only and patients with chronic periodontitis and diabetes were evaluated for levels of leptin and visfatin in the gingival tissues before and after non-surgical periodontal therapy.

primary_outcome.description: estimation of protein and gene expression of visfatin in patients with chronic periodontitis only and diabetic patients with periodontitis before and after non-surgical periodontal therapy..
estimation of protein and gene expression of leptin in patients with chronic periodontitis only and diabetic patients with periodontitis before and after non-surgical periodontal therapy..

secondary_outcome.description: estimation of pocket depth in patients with chronic periodontitis only and diabetic patients with periodontitis before and after non-surgical periodontal therapy.
estimation of clinical attachment level in patients with chronic periodontitis only and diabetic patients with periodontitis before and after non-surgical periodontal therapy.

arm_group.description: non-surgical periodontal therapy with ultrasonic scalers and periodontal curettes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diabetic patients having diabetes mellitus ≥5 years prior to the study.
- chronic periodontitis with clinical attachment loss > 5 mm.
- otherwise systemically healthy subjects.
Exclusion Criteria:
- any known systemic diseases other than diabetes.
- pregnancy or lactation.
- smokers.
- receiving periodontal treatment in the last 6 months.
- taking any drugs or medications other than anti-diabetic drugs.
